lots.description: Description of the procurement: The project is part of a programme to improve the street environment of Hades City.  The chosen supplier will take responsibility for the supply installation and maintenance of lighting for 100Km of streets and highways

description: The project is receiving up to GBP 2.7 million of funding from the England European Regional Development Fund as part of the European Structural and Investment Funds Growth Programme 2014-2020. The Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (and in London the intermediate body Greater London Authority) is the Managing Authority for European Regional Development Fund. Established by the European Union, the European Regional Development Fund helps local areas stimulate their economic development by investing in projects which will support innovation, businesses, create jobs and local community regenerations. For more information visit https://www.gov.uk/european-growth-funding

tender.title: 1920-59-RIS-LW ERDF Funded — ITT FOR a Matrix-assisted Laser Desorption Ionization (MALDI) imaging Mass Spectrometer, Micro Computerised Tomography (Micro CT) Scanner and Atomic Force Microscopy-Ra
tender.description:
Contract noticeSheffield Hallam University has been awarded substantial funding by the European Regional Development Fund to create the Sheffield Testing Imaging and Characterisation Centre. As part of this funding instrumentation for Matrix Assisted Laser Desorption Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MALDI-MSI) (Lot 1), High Resolution Benchtop Micro Computerised Tomography (Lot 2) and Atomic Force Microscopy-Raman (AFM-Raman) Spectroscopy (Lot 3) will be purchased.
The project is receiving funding from the England European Regional Development Fund as part of the European Structural and Investment Funds Growth Programme 2014-2020. The Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (and in London the intermediate body Greater London Authority) is the Managing Authority for European Regional Development Fund.

lots.title: ot 1: A Mass Spectrometry Imaging System Incorporating a Matrix Assisted Laser Desorption Ionisation Source, an Electrospray Source3 and nhplc/uplc System(s)
lots.description:
The project is receiving up to GBP 2.7 million of funding from the England European Regional Development Fund as part of the European Structural and Investment Funds Growth Programme 2014-2020. The Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (and in London the intermediate body Greater London Authority) is the Managing Authority for European Regional Development Fund. Established by the European Union, the European Regional Development Fund helps local areas stimulate their economic development by investing in projects which will support innovation, businesses, create jobs and local community regenerations. For more information visit https://www.gov.uk/european-growth-funding

The Northern Powerhouse is a key aspect of this Government’s approach to addressing the productivity gap in the North and ensuring a stronger, more sustainable economy for all parts of the UK. Alongside over EUR 1.5 billion of European Regional Development Fund support for businesses and communities across the North, the government has awarded GBP3.4 billion in three rounds of Growth Deals across the Northern Powerhouse.

The likely use of the MALDI Mass Spectrometer will be in the analysis of molecules in a range of biological and chemical samples. Industry sectors that this will impact will be: chemical manufacturers, pharmaceutical companies, forensic testing, agricultural product manufacturers and food and beverage companies. The benefits/likely outcomes are efficacy and safety testing of existing or new products (validated research materials for marketing purposes, compliance with product regulations). Also, identification of mode of action of products (novel used of existing products).

The likely use of the Integrated AFM-Raman Imaging System will be in biotech, pharmaceuticals, high precision engineering, NHS, and Private healthcare centres and SMEs developing new products.

tender.submissionMethodDetails: http://www.shu.ac.uk or testname, Sheffield, United Kingdom. NUTS code: UK. test@tgmail.com, tel: +44 6565456789, https://est.co.uk, buyer profile: https://est.co.uk

description:
In the meantime, if you are not already registered, we recommend you register on AGCSU’s Procurement Portal, EU Supply.

To register on the portal:

— https://uk.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=UK

— from the portal Home Page, click the ‘New Supplier Registration’ link on the left if you have not registered before, or log in on the right if your organisation is already registered (please note the portal will not allow multiple registrations for the same organisation so if your company already has log in details, these must be utilised);

— By registering, or logging in you are accepting the terms and conditions for using the portal If you require technical support in submitting your expression of interest, please contact:

• uksupport@eu-supply.com

• 0800 840 2050 during working hours ONLY (8.00 to 17.00).

Please note there will be no detail regarding the project present on the portal currently, but you may wish to prepare your organisation’s log in details and access arrangements for relevant staff.

tender.title: Phase 2 – Lived Experiences Services Framework Procurement on Behalf of NHS England and NHS Improvement
tender.description:
This framework is directed towards suppliers who provide lived experience services, in particular those who support persons who have come in to contact with the health and justice sector, or might be at particular risk of in the future and/or their families and carers. For clarity, the following sectors of health and justice are included:
• liaison and diversion
• sexual assault referral centres (SARCs),
• community sentence treatment requirements,
• children and young people,
• female prison estate,
• immigration removal centres (ICRS),
• Courts and healthcare,
• Prisons.
Any value stated within this notice is not applicable due to it being related to the creation of a framework.
